body: So recently I've been full of emotions (in real life reasons) and I need to find some way to calm down and relax, and I've tried all the things my friends have told me but none of it still works. I was hoping you guys may have some ideas on what I can do and it would mean a lot of you'd share them ^_^
body_tagged: So recently I've been full of emotions (in real life reasons) and I need to find some way to calm down and relax, and I've tried all the things my friends have told me but none of it still works. I was hoping you guys may have some ideas on what I can do and it would mean a lot of you'd share them ^_^
title: I need some advice/help..

replies.body:
Sleep
Write whatever is in your mind down
Play games where you don't rage
Don't think about homework
replies.body_tagged:
Sleep
Write whatever is in your mind down
Play games where you don't rage
Don't think about homework

replies.body: Listen to some music, heavy stuff is often the best. May I suggest Imagine Dragons or ACDC
replies.body_tagged: Listen to some music, heavy stuff is often the best. May I suggest Imagine Dragons or ACDC

replies.body: Listen to music or watch YouTube or Netflix
replies.body_tagged: Listen to music or watch YouTube or Netflix

replies.body_tagged: Have a life

replies.body:
Turn off your computer. Stop your addiction to minecraft (not trying to be rude, just saying minecraft tends to make some people mad). Sports also help me. Go to the gym or play football and use your anger in that to let it out. Always works for me.


Good luck

replies.body:
Speaking from experience... 
Go read a lot of books. Do stuff to help out in your local community. Sleep. Talk to family members. Write short stories. Shop. Volunteer your time. Watch movies. Become more religious. Go on trips. Sports events.  Explore areas outside of your comfort zone. Video games are still ok just learn jot to rage as much.

replies.body:
Nova, I get it, you don't like him, I don't either, but you're being extremely rude, and he just asked for help... And you've been asked multiple times to stop, and you don't. I understand, you dislike him, but he asked for help, why don't you be nice for a change and try to help him, even if you do dislike him. He's still a person.

OP: Try reading, playing a peaceful game, sports, just running around outside, even if it's not to get stronger, it helps me clear my mind and calm down, don't do anything that's competitive and fast paced

replies.body:
This has been dealt with by other Moderators, but I'm going to reinforce it. Nova, please do not start flame wars. It's not tolerated, especially on a topic like this.

@Dawson:

I've got a few. First off, if you're feeling angry, try and punch something. I'll punch a pillow, since it won't hurt me. A less destructive way of getting out anger is spending time with animals, especially dogs. They do brighten up your mood.

As for sadness, do NOT be afraid to cry sometimes. You need to cry, just let it out.

If you want to have the best results, listen to happy and feel good music. Watch a funny movie, hang out with friends and even look through some photos that contain good memories.

Hope this helped!

replies.body:
When I have a crap ton of stressful things happening in my life (always) I sometimes take a walk and listen to some motivational music (or at least something that'll pump me up) If I'm angry I'll take deep breaths (tons) and just walk, If need be, stomp it out on the ground. One more thing, if you're angry or just feeling really stressed/sad, if you can, go to the gym. I do, and for the time I do, I pretty much forget about everything else and put all my energy to lift/run/exercise as much as possible. When you come home, you're tired and you want to relax. It also releases certain chemicals in your brain that raise your mood. If not that or if you want to do more, play a sport. If I really don't feel like being with anyone, I just play hard by myself and focus on playing the sport, nothing else, I would honestly recommend playing with friends though as they help raise your mood and you have some competition that'll boost you to player harder, further taking your stress of your mind. One more thing that I usually do is set goals for myself. I like to imagine myself with my goals completed, and that motivates me to do things rather than sitting idly.Hang out with friends you trust, and really really try to be nice to others. Do something that's very thoughtful and once you do, you feel so good that you did something nice. Don't do it so you get something in return, but just because you can. It honestly makes me feel really happy and great. Maybe if someone is having a bad day, cheer them up and listen to them. Give your parents or friend a surprise, or just help out someone you see who needs help. That's what I'd recommend to do. 

Also, don't forget about your stress unless it's a thought about yourself or about someone else (like a bad thought ex: you hating yourself/hating someone else). If the cause for your pain is something else, a family matter, try finding a way to fix it. Don't let it overwhelm you either. If the cause is a problem, try fixing it as it may come back and bite you again, making your situation much worse. (don't know if I was able to elaborate and properly explain what I exactly meant)

I hope this helps, feel better and have a great day! :D

Turn off your computer. Stop your addiction to minecraft (not trying to be rude, just saying minecraft tends to make some people mad). Sports also help me. Go to the gym or play football and use your anger in that to let it out. Always works for me.


Good luck

replies.body:
Honestly Dawson we have had our ups and downs, but I'm not gonna be like nova just because you are going through a tough time.

So what you should do is find a good show on Netflix and chill with your right hand. :P

Also, you can try doing an outside activity or just sit on a chair outside your house and just look at the view, it helps me!

Good Luck m9

replies.body:
Depends on level of sadness, etc. 
If somewhat sad, happy music.
Pretty sad = sad asf music: 
Witt Lowry - Kindest Regards 
Witt Lowry - Dreaming With Our Eyes Open 
Katawa Shoujo OST - Cold Iron 
Katawa Shoujo OST - Moment of Decision 

The sad music actually helps A LOT

Social interaction or interaction with a pet can help a lot.
